intro: Hedera aurantiaca fructu-rubro, commonly known as the red-fruited ivy, is a climbing plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lobed leaves that often have a reddish tinge. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by bright red berries, which are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in shaded environments and is often used as a decorative vine in gardens and indoor spaces. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant fruit color and adaptability to various soil types.
